author: Laurence Fletcher
title: U.S. Hedge Funds File Lawsuit Over Marine Fuel Firm’s Deal
text:
A group of activist investors has filed a lawsuit against Aegean Marine Petroleum Network Inc., the world’s biggest independent supplier of physical marine fuel, accusing it of trying to conduct “a corrupt corporate acquisition,” the latest example of U.S.-style activism in Europe.
The lawsuit, filed in the Southern District of New York on Thursday, is seeking a temporary restraining order in an effort to block Athens-headquartered, U.S.-listed Aegean’s $367 million purchase of H.E.C. Europe Limited, a company that recovers... To Read the Full Story Subscribe Sign In
